intro: Boehmeria peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian nettle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its finely serrated leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The fibers of its stems are used in traditional crafts and have potential applications in modern textile production.
